intro: Aistopetalum multiflorum, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has strap-like, evergreen leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale blue flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. Aistopetalum multiflorum is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
